author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Child sandwiched between parents on scooter motivated me to build Nano: Tata
text: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata took to Instagram to share a picture of him with Tata Nano, the compact car that he launched in 2008. "What really motivated me...was constantly seeing Indian families on scooters, maybe the child sandwiched between the mother and father," Tata wrote on building Nano. "Nano was always meant for all our people," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Misleading: Air India on woman's panic attack video after boarding denied at airport
text: Air India said, "It's conveying a misleading image of Air India being apathetic towards a passenger," after a video showed that a woman allegedly suffered a panic attack at Delhi airport. In the video shared on Instagram, it was alleged the woman and her relatives were denied boarding by Air India staff due to a delay of a few minutes.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Campbell Wilson appointed CEO and MD of Air India
text: Tata Sons has appointed Campbell Wilson as the new CEO and MD of Air India. "It's an honour to be selected to lead the iconic Air India. It's at the cusp of an exciting journey to become one of the best airlines," Wilson said. The 50-year-old New Zealand-born executive recently resigned as CEO of Singapore Airlines budget carrier Scoot.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Musk's delay in disclosing Twitter stake under probe by US SEC: WSJ
text: The US SEC is investigating Tesla CEO Elon Musk's delay in disclosing his Twitter stake last month, the WSJ reported. Musk had revealed his 9.2% stake in Twitter to SEC on April 4, a delay of at least 10 days since surpassing the 5% threshold for revealing a shareholding. Musk has lately been embroiled in a dispute with the SEC.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: HC allows Xiaomi conditional access to seized ₹5,551 cr: Report
text: The Karnataka High Court has declined to reinstate a freeze on ₹5,551 crore belonging to Chinese smartphone-maker Xiaomi, Hindustan Times reported citing Reuters. The funds were seized by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with "illegal outward remittances" but the seizure was stayed after Xiaomi appealed. The Court also allowed Xiaomi to use a bank overdraft facility to make payments.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Elon Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private were reckless: US judge
text: A US judge said in an April judgement that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets on taking Tesla private were inaccurate and reckless, adding "there was nothing concrete" about financing from Saudi Arabia's PIF. "Rather, discussions between Tesla and the PIF were clearly at the preliminary stage," the judge added. Musk has insisted that tweets were entirely truthful.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: 24x7 digital payments helpline 'DigiSaathi' now on WhatsApp: NPCI
text: The government's 24x7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' that provides information on digital payment products and services is now available on WhatsApp, the National Payments Commission of India (NPCI) said. Users can access the helpline by texting +91-892-891-3333 via WhatsApp. It answers queries on cards, UPI, NEFT, RTGS, Wallets, ATM, QR (UPI/Bharat), mobile and net banking, among others.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SoftBank's Vision Fund reports record $26 billion loss
text: Japan's SoftBank Group reported a record $26.2 billion loss at its Vision Fund investment arm on Thursday. The group also reported a net loss of $13.2 billion for the financial year that ended March 31. This is reportedly its biggest full-year loss which followed a nearly $38.8 billion net profit in the previous fiscal year.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Toyota to make EV parts in India for domestic, export markets
text: Toyota Kirloskar Motor's Senior VP Vikram Gulati said the firm plans to make EV parts in India to meet domestic demand as well as for export to Japan and some ASEAN countries. It plans to start with making e-drives or electric powertrain parts used by different EV types. Gulati added Toyota aspires to make India manufacturing hub for cleaner technologies.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Ford drops plans to make EVs for exports in India
text: Ford Motor has dropped plans to make electric vehicles (EVs) in India for exports. "After careful review, we have decided to no longer pursue EV manufacturing for exports from any of the Indian plants," a spokesperson said. In September 2021, Ford had announced it would cease local manufacturing in India, citing an operating loss of $2 billion over 10 years.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Morgan Stanley cuts India's GDP growth forecasts by 30 bps
text: Morgan Stanley has lowered its forecasts for India's GDP growth to 7.6% for FY23 and 6.7% for FY24, 30 basis points lower than the previous estimates. Both inflation and the country's current account deficit will likely get worse, it said. The report cited a global slowdown, surging oil prices and weak domestic demand as some of the reasons.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: US inflation rises 8.3% in April, slight drop from March's 40-yr-high
text: Retail inflation in the US rose 8.3% in April from 12 months earlier, the country's Labor Department said on Wednesday. This is however below the 8.5% y-o-y rise in March, which was the highest rate in 40 years since 1981. On a month-to-month basis, prices rose 0.3% from March to April, the smallest increase in eight months.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: State laws don't apply to RBI-registered NBFCs: Supreme Court
text: State moneylending laws would have no application on non-banking finance companies (NBFCs) registered with and regulated by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the Supreme Court (SC) said on Tuesday. The court observed that the Chapter III­B of the RBI Act is a complete code in itself. Earlier,  the Kerala High Court had said the state moneylending laws were applicable.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Step up exports to $100 bn for $1 tn economy by 2030: Tamil Nadu CM
text: Tamil Nadu's export share stands at $26 billion and this should be increased to $100 billion by 2030, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said. He added that this would help meet the Centre's target of achieving $1 trillion economy by 2030. The southern zone's share in India's exports will increase from 27% to 35% in five years, he further said.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: SC refuses interim relief to those seeking stay on LIC IPO allotment
text: The Supreme Court on Thursday refused to grant interim relief to petitioners who challenged amendments to the LIC Act by Finance Act of 2021 and demanded a stay on the insurer's IPO allotment process. "We're not inclined to grant any interim relief," SC said. It also sought the Centre and LIC's replies on the batch of pleas within eight weeks.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ramkrishna, Subramanian's bail pleas in NSE scam case rejected
text: A Delhi court on Thursday dismissed the bail pleas filed by NSE's ex-CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and ex-Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian in connection with the co-location scam case. The CBI told the court that the accused, holding influential positions, could tamper with the evidence and must be kept in custody. Ramkrishna has been accused of frequently revising Subramanian's designation.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Govt eases environmental rules for coal mines to tackle fuel crisis
text: The Centre has eased environmental approvals for expansion of coal mines to boost output amid the ongoing fuel crisis across the country. A government note said the move will enable raising coal production by a further 10% without requiring new impact assessments. Rules on consulting local residents about the expansions have also been loosened, the note added.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Bitcoin briefly drops below $30,000 for first time since July 2021
text: Bitcoin, in the early hours of Tuesday, fell below $30,000 for the first time since July 2021. Its value fell as low as $29,764 on Tuesday before recovering above $30,000. Bitcoin's value has more than halved from its all-time high which was close to $69,000 in November. The fall in cryptocurrencies followed a drop in US equities and other markets.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Bill Gates tests positive for COVID-19
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates took to Twitter on Tuesday and wrote, "I've tested positive for COVID-19. I'm experiencing mild symptoms and am following the experts' advice by isolating until I'm healthy again." "I'm fortunate to be vaccinated and boosted and have access to testing and great medical care," he added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: SBI hikes interest rates on bulk term deposits from today
text: SBI has increased interest rates on its bulk term deposits of ₹2 crore and above across all its tenors except for the 7-45 days tenor. Effective from May 10, for the 46-179 days tenor, the rate has been increased to 3.50% from 3% and for 180-210 days tenor, the rate has been hiked to 3.50% from 3.10%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: After Musk's Taj Mahal tweet, his mother says his grandparents flew there in 1954
text: After Elon Musk tweeted he visited Taj Mahal in 2007 and called it a "wonder of the world", his mother Maye Musk shared that his grandparents flew to the Taj Mahal from South Africa in 1954. She tweeted, "The only people to ever do this trip in a single-engine propeller plane, without a radio or GPS. Their motto 'Live dangerously...carefully'."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: When are you coming to deliver 1st Tesla? Paytm CEO on Musk's Taj Mahal tweet
text: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to react to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet on the Taj Mahal. Sharma tweeted, "It'll be an incredible challenge for Tesla to build FSD for India. We're known to be the most unruly road users. That said, when are you coming here to deliver the first Tesla here at the Taj?
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Microsoft to help cover US employees' travel costs for abortion
text: Microsoft has said that it will cover travel costs for employees in the US who need to travel out of state for an abortion. The move comes after a recent draft leak from US Supreme Court proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide. Several companies, including Yelp, Tesla and Amazon, among others have pledged to cover this cost for their American employees.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Layout of 'world's first Bitcoin City' in El Salvador unveiled, President shares pics
text: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele has shared the layout of the 'world's first Bitcoin City' that will initially be funded by Bitcoin-backed bonds. Bukele shared on Twitter pictures of a gold-coloured 3D model and rendered images of the city. 'Bitcoin City' will be constructed at the foot of a volcano which is being used to mine Bitcoin using geothermal energy.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Office as we know it, is over: Airbnb CEO on letting staff work remotely forever
text: After Airbnb allowed its employees to work remotely forever, the company's CEO Brian Chesky said, "I think that the office as we know it, is over." He added, "We can't try to hold on to 2019 any more than 1950. We have to move forward." Chesky questioned whether the office would be invented today if it didn't already exist.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Twitter will comply with EU content rules after takeover: Elon Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Twitter will comply with European Union’s rules on content once his proposed takeover is completed. Musk met Thierry Breton, the EU’s Internal Market Commissioner on Monday for the same. The EU agreed on the Digital Services Act last month, which was aimed at urging technology platforms to better police their published content.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk's $44 bn Twitter deal at risk of being repriced lower, warns short-seller
text: Elon Musk's $44 billion offer to buy Twitter could get repriced lower if he walked away from the deal, short-seller Hindenburg Research warned on Monday. "Musk holds all the cards here," Hindenburg, which has a short position on Twitter, said. "If Musk's bid for Twitter disappeared tomorrow, Twitter's equity would fall by 50% from current levels," it added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Zomato's market cap falls below its last private valuation of $5.4 billion
text: Zomato's market capitalisation fell below its last private valuation of $5.4 billion on Tuesday after the food delivery platform's shares hit a new all-time low. Zomato's shares fell 7.22% on Tuesday to end at ₹52.65 on the NSE, giving it a market capitalisation of about $5.3 billion. Notably, Zomato's rival Swiggy was valued at $10.7 billion earlier this year.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt calls meeting with Uber, Ola amid rising consumer complaints
text: The Centre has called a meeting with cab aggregators Ola and Uber on Tuesday to discuss their policies after it received various complaints from consumers about their unfair trade practices, ride cancellation policy and surge pricing, among others. It will also seek information from them on how they calculate fares, cancellation charges and measures for consumer data protection.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Pakistani rupee falls to all-time low against US dollar
text: The Pakistani rupee fell to an all-time low against US dollar on Tuesday in the interbank market. Its value surged by 82 paisa in early trade and is currently trading at PKR 188.35 in the interbank market. Meanwhile, State Bank of Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves fell by $328 million to $10.558 billion during the week that ended on April 23.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: JSW Group will make a $7 billion bid for Ambuja Cements, ACC: Chairman
text: JSW Group's Chairman Sajjan Jindal told Financial Times that the steel-to-energy conglomerate will make a $7 billion bid for Holcim's India subsidiaries Ambuja Cements and ACC. JSW will offer $4.5 billion in its own equity and $2.5 billion from undisclosed private equity partners for the bid. It was earlier reported that Adani Group is in talks to acquire Holcim's assets.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Pfizer to buy Biohaven for $11.6 bn in its biggest deal since 2016
text: Pfizer will acquire biotech group Biohaven Pharmaceuticals for $11.6 billion, marking its biggest deal since 2016. Biohaven's Rimegepant medication, used as both a treatment and preventative for migraines, is expected to bring in sales of over $4 billion by 2030. This comes as Pfizer expects sales of its COVID-19 vaccines to drop from last year's highs.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Canada, US' electric aircraft firms want to manufacture in India: Scindia
text: Several electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) companies from the US and Canada are interested in setting up units in India, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday. He added that eVTOL aircrafts are currently being used by the defence forces of the two countries. An e-VTOL aircraft uses electric power to hover, take off and land vertically.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Will stay at Tesla as long as I can be useful: Elon Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on being asked about how long he expects to stay at Tesla, said, "As long as I can be useful." Musk, who is in talks to buy Twitter, is expected to become the platform's temporary CEO. Earlier in July 2021, Musk had said he has tried "very hard not to be the CEO of Tesla".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tesla halts production at China plant due to supply issues: Report
text: Tesla has halted production at its Shanghai plant due to issues with securing parts for its EVs, Reuters reported citing sources. Tesla's Shanghai plant produces the Model 3 sedan and Model Y crossover for the China market and for export. Tesla partially resumed production at the plant on April 19 following a 22-day closure caused by the city's COVID-19 lockdown.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tiger Global hit by $17 bn losses in tech stock sell-off: Report
text: Tiger Global has faced losses of around $17 billion during this year's technology stock sell-off, the Financial Times reported. The firm has erased around two-thirds of its gains in four months, the report added citing calculations by LCH Investments. The losses are reportedly higher than some of the $4-trillion hedge fund industry's most recent losses.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: India looking at tapping new markets for edible oil: Sitharaman
text: India is looking at tapping new markets for the import of edible oils, following the conflict between Ukraine and Russia, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "There are various hurdles in terms of importing oils. You know we are not able to import edible oil; we were getting sunflower oil. Now, we are not," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Canara Bank detects frauds worth ₹3.9 cr in internal probe: Report
text: State-led Canara Bank is investigating fraud in its housing finance unit Can Fin Homes after a whistleblower alleged irregularities in certain accounts, Reuters reported quoting a source. The bank has detected frauds in 37 accounts worth ₹3.9 crore, the source said. They added that fake income tax return documents had been submitted for these accounts.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: We need to revitalise world economy in inclusive ways: Raghuram Rajan
text: Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that in order to raise investment and productivity, the need is to revitalise global growth in inclusive ways. In an article published in Financial Times, Rajan said, "The easiest solution economically, and the hardest politically, is to reverse the trend to deglobalisation." Developing countries' public spending has been constrained in the pandemic, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Malaysia may cut palm oil export tax by half: Report
text: The Commodities Ministry of the world's second-largest palm oil producer Malaysia has proposed to cut the export tax on the oil by half amid a global edible oil shortage. Malaysia's Plantation Industries and Commodities Minister Zuraida Kamaruddin told Reuters that the country could temporarily cut the tax from 8% to 4%-6%. Recently, top global producer Indonesia banned palm oil exports.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Equity investors' wealth falls over ₹11.22 lakh crore in 3 days
text: Equity investors have become poorer by over ₹11.22 lakh crore in three days following a sell-off in markets amid weak global cues. Sensex fell for the third consecutive session on Tuesday, falling 1,337.38 points or 2.4% since Friday. Foreign institutional investors remained net-sellers on Monday, offloading shares worth a net ₹3,361.80 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Axis Bank awaits probe report on alleged mutual fund scam: Report
text: Axis Bank will wait for the report on an investigation into alleged front-running at Axis Mutual Fund (MF) before taking the final decision on penalising guilty officials, Moneycontrol reported. The allegations are being probed by two external agencies appointed by Axis MF. The probe was launched in February 2022, Axis MF MD and CEO Chandresh Nigam said on May 8.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's outward FDI drops nearly 50% y-o-y to $3.39 bn in April
text: India's outward foreign direct investment (OFDI) nearly halved to $3.39 billion in April on an annual basis, data released by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. In comparison, the OFDI stood at $6.71 billion in April 2021 and $3.44 billion in March 2022. The equity component in April was $544.87 million and loans amounted to $764.25 million.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: CBI raids 8 places in Jammu, Srinagar, Mumbai in J&K Bank scam case
text: The CBI on Tuesday searched eight locations in Jammu, Srinagar and Mumbai in connection with alleged irregularities in purchase of a building by J&K Bank in Mumbai in 2010, officials said. They added that this included searching the premises of then J&K Bank Chairman Haseeb Drabu. In April, the ED questioned former J&K CM Omar Abdullah in the same case.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Rupee hits all-time low of 77.42 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday, Reuters reported. Asian markets were lower on Monday as US stock futures fell on fears of more policy tightening from the Federal Reserve and strict lockdown in Shanghai impacting global growth, according to Reuters.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Bitcoin falls to the lowest level since January, trades below $34,000
text: Bitcoin fell on Monday to as low as $33,266 in morning trade, nearing January's low of $32,951 as slumping equity markets continued to hurt cryptocurrencies. It then steadied to trade above $33,600. According to BBC, the world's largest cryptocurrency has fallen by 50% since its peak in November 2021.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Made best possible decision: IndiGo on barring differently-abled child from flight
text: IndiGo's CEO Ronojoy Dutta said the airline made "the best possible decision" by barring a differently-abled teenager and his family from boarding a Ranchi-Hyderabad flight. "At boarding area, the teenager was visibly in panic...the airport staff, in line with safety guidelines, were forced to make a difficult decision," Dutta said. IndiGo offered to purchase an electric wheelchair for the child.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Rupee closes at all-time low of 77.50 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee weakened further on Monday to close at a new all-time low of 77.50 against the US dollar, 60 paise over its previous close. During the trading session, the rupee touched its lifetime low of 77.52. The currency was weighed down by elevated crude oil prices and a widening trade deficit.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India's biggest IPO of LIC subscribed nearly 3 times on final day of bidding
text: LIC's IPO, India's biggest IPO which opened on May 4 and closed on May 9, was subscribed 2.95 times on Monday. Expected to raise ₹20,557 crore, the IPO received bids for 47.83 crore equity shares against the IPO size of 16.2 crore shares. The policyholders' portion was subscribed 6.11 times, employees bid 4.39 times and retail investors bid 1.99 times.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I will do my best to stay alive: Musk to his mother after 'mysterious dying' tweet
text: Soon after Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a tweet about his "mysterious death", his mother Maye Musk commented that it wasn't funny. Responding to her, Musk wrote, "Sorry! I will do my best to stay alive." Musk's 'dying' tweet came after he shared a statement by the Roscosmos director that threatened him for supplying "fascist forces" to Ukraine.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Japan will cease to exist, Venice dying due to very low birth rates: Musk
text: The world's richest man Elon Musk recently tweeted, "At the risk of stating the obvious, unless something changes to cause the birth rate to exceed the death rate, Japan will eventually cease to exist." He added, "This would be a great loss for the world." In another tweet, Musk said, "Venice is slowly dying due to very low birth rates."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: If I die under mysterious circumstances, nice knowing ya: Musk after Russian threats
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya." Shortly before this, Musk shared a post that he said was a statement by the Roscosmos director Dmitry Olegovich Rogozin to Russian media that accused Musk of supplying "fascist forces in Ukraine". "Elon, you'll be held accountable like an adult," the statement read.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Uber will treat hiring as a 'privilege' to cut costs: CEO
text: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi told employees in an e-mail that the company needs to cut costs, citing "the market is experiencing a seismic shift", CNBC reported. "We'll treat hiring as a privilege and be deliberate about when and where we add headcount," the CEO said. "We have to make sure our unit economics work before we go big," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Investigating it myself: Scindia after IndiGo denies boarding to differently-abled child
text: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said he is investigating the matter himself wherein IndiGo denied boarding to a differently-abled child at the Ranchi airport. He added that appropriate action will also be taken. A social media post along with a video of the incident went viral on Sunday after it detailed how IndiGo staff denied boarding to the child.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: FM Sitharaman gets water for NSDL MD during her speech at an event, video viral
text: A video has surfaced on social media wherein Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman could be seen offering water to the Managing Director of National Securities Depository Limited, Padmaja Chunduru. While Chunduru asked for water from hotel staff during her speech, Sitharaman came on stage and offered her water during the event held to celebrate the silver jubilee of NSDL.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: GST Council may consider highest 28% tax on cryptocurrencies: Report
text: The GST Council is considering levying a 28% tax on cryptocurrencies and their related services, as per a report. While the proposal is likely to be discussed in the next GST Council meeting, its date is yet to be decided. Notably, the Finance Ministry has already imposed a 30% income tax on earnings from virtual digital asset transactions.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: British airline EasyJet to take out seats from planes so it can fly with fewer crew
text: British low-cost airline EasyJet plans to remove seats on some of its planes so it can operate flights with fewer cabin crew. The airline, which has been facing a staff shortage, is cancelling around 30 flights daily. It will be removing the back row from 60 of its A319 jets, which will limit the passengers to 150 instead of 156.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: US imposes new sanctions on 27 Gazprombank, 8 Sberbank executives
text: The US on Sunday imposed new sanctions against three Russian television stations and banned 27 executives from Gazprombank in response to Ukraine's invasion of Russia. This is the first time that the US has imposed sanctions involving Russian gas exporter Gazprombank. The new sanctions also included eight executives from Sberbank, and Moscow Industrial Bank and its 10 subsidiaries.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rupee is in ICU under PM Modi: Cong after rupee hits all-time low
text: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Monday said the Indian rupee "is in ICU (intensive care unit)" under PM Narendra Modi's government after the rupee fell to an all-time low of ₹77.42 against the US dollar. Surjewala said rising inflation and depleting foreign reserves are causing the rupee to fall. "BJP-sponsored" communal tension is also responsible for the fall, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Paytm grants 39.7 lakh ESOPs to employees as its share price falls
text: Paytm-parent One97 Communications has granted 39.7 lakh new employee stock ownership plans (ESOPs) to its employees as Paytm's share price fell to one of its lowest levels since November. The exercise price of the new ESOPs has been set at ₹9 each. As per Paytm's stock price on Monday, the value of the ESOPs is estimated to be ₹220.7 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Toyota to invest ₹4,800 cr in Karnataka, will create 3,500 jobs
text: The Toyota Group has signed an MoU with the Karnataka government for a ₹4,800 crore investment in the state. As per the company's statement, the investment aims to promote green technology and set up local manufacturing facilities to build electric powertrain parts and components. The move will generate around 3,500 direct jobs, said Toyota Kirloskar Motor's Executive VP Vikram Gulati.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Adani Airports raises $250 million for airports development
text: Adani Airports has raised $250 million funding from a consortium of Standard Chartered and Barclays Bank with an option to raise another $200 million. The funds raised will be used to scale up the airports business into "one of the largest airport platforms globally," a spokesperson said. Adani Airports manages airports in Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Lucknow, Mangaluru and Jaipur, among others.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: LIC's public issue has been successful: DIPAM Secretary
text: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Monday said the LIC's IPO offer "has met with tremendous success". The LIC IPO, which started on May 4, has been closed today after being oversubscribed 2.95 times. While the policyholder position has been subscribed 6.11 times, the employees portion has been subscribed 4.39 times.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LIC IPO shares to be allocated on May 12, listing on May 17
text: Bidders in LIC IPO will be allocated shares on May 12, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey has said. He added that LIC will be listed on stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which opened on May 4 and closed on May 9, received 47.83 crore bids against 16.2 crore shares on offer.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Pushp Kumar Joshi takes over as HPCL Chairman & MD
text: Pushp Kumar Joshi on Sunday took over as the new Chairman and Managing Director of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), India's third-largest oil refining and fuel marketing company. Prior to this, Joshi was the Director-HR of the state-owned firm. He has replaced Mukesh Kumar Surana, who was superannuated from services on April 30, 2022.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Reliance's shares decline 3% after Q4 results, fall 9.8% in 6 days
text: Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) shares declined 3% to ₹2,542.10 in the early hours of trading on Monday after the company's January-March quarter results were declared. RIL's shares have fallen 9.82% since April 29. RIL reported a 22.5% YoY rise in net profit to ₹16,203 crore and a 35% YoY rise in consolidated revenue to ₹2.32 lakh crore in Q4 FY22.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Unemployment rate fell from 10.3% to 8.7% in Oct-Dec 2021: NSO
text: The unemployment rate for people above 15 years in urban areas slipped from 10.3% to 8.7% between October and December 2021, the National Statistical Office (NSO) data revealed on Sunday. Among males, the unemployment rate dipped to 8.3% in October-December 2021 compared to 9.5% a year ago. Meanwhile, among females, the rate fell from 13.1% to 10.5% y-o-y.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Deeply distressed with rumour mongering: Axis AMC Founder CEO on alleged scam
text: Axis Asset Management Company (AMC) Founder CEO Rajiv Anand on Monday said he is deeply depressed with rumour mongering regarding allegations that two of fund managers (FMs) at Axis Mutual Fund have been removed from their positions for front-running. "If there is a problem, we will address it. Do not malign the reputations of the highly skilled professionals," Anand said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Retail investors have become shock absorbers in equities: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said retail investors have played a key role in the markets in the last two years. "[They] have shown...what they can do by standing up and becoming shock absorbers, unlike FPIs," she stated. Her statement comes as foreign portfolio investors pulled out ₹6,417 crore from the Indian stock markets in the first week of May.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: LIC IPO booked 1.79 times on Day 5; policyholders booked 5.04 times
text: Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) public issue was subscribed 1.79 times on the fifth day of bidding on Sunday. The offer has received bids for 29.07 crore equity shares against the IPO size of 16.2 crore equity shares. The policyholder portion was booked 5.04 times, followed by the employee portion, which was booked 3.79 times.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: NCLT orders insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres
text: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has ordered the initiation of insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres in a case filed by multi-business chemicals firm SRF. As per SRF, Birla Tyres defaulted on payment of ₹15.84 crore for the supply of tyre cord fabric as of July 8, 2021. NCLT reprimanded Birla Tyres for taking a "casual attempt" to seek adjournments.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Musk, Twitter sued by Florida pension fund to delay $44 bn deal
text: Elon Musk and Twitter were sued by a Florida pension fund seeking to stop Musk from completing his $44 billion buyout before 2025. The fund cited a Delaware law under which shareholders who own over 15% of a company can't enter a merger without two-thirds of remaining shares granting approval. Musk is effective "owner" of over 15% of Twitter shares.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Best investment you'll make: Poonawalla suggests Musk to make Tesla cars in India
text: The Serum Institute of India's Adar Poonawalla on Sunday suggested Tesla CEO Elon Musk to invest in India by manufacturing Tesla cars in the country. Poonawalla wrote, "Just in case you don't end up buying Twitter, do look at investing...in India for high-quality large-scale manufacturing of Tesla cars. I assure you this will be the best investment you'll ever make."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Who is Jared Birchall, who manages the world's richest man Elon Musk's wealth?
text: Jared Birchall is the Managing Director of Excession, the family office of the world's richest man Elon Musk that handles his almost $250 billion fortune. Birchall also serves various roles at the Musk Foundation, Musk's school Ad Astra and his brain-implant startup Neuralink, and several of Musk's other LLCs. He has recently helped Musk secure financing for $44-billion Twitter takeover.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk didn't have plan for Twitter: CEO of Binance which is investing $500 mn in buyout
text: Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao told Financial Times that the cryptocurrency exchange's $500 million investment to help Elon Musk acquire Twitter is "more of a blank cheque". He said, "[Musk] didn't have a plan for Twitter. There isn't...a business plan." Zhao further said, "After the investment...Elon will figure out what he wants to do, and we'll be supportive of that."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon driver leaves 'kind' message for girl fighting cancer in US, Bezos reacts
text: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos took to Instagram Stories to share the story of Amazon driver Asani Anderson who left a message for an 8-year-old girl battling cancer in US while dropping off packages. "Amazon is praying 4 Aubrey luv you!" the message by Anderson read. Reacting to the gesture, Bezos wrote on Instagram, "Kindness makes our world better...Anderson embodies it."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Baseless and untrue: ED as Xiaomi alleges it threatened staff with 'violence'
text: After Xiaomi alleged in a court filing that its top executives faced threats of "physical violence" during a probe by the Enforcement Directorate (ED), the agency responded saying that the claims are "untrue and baseless". The ED said that "there was no coercion or threat to the officers of the company" and that they deposed their statements before ED voluntarily.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Work ethic expectations from Twitter employees will be extreme: Elon Musk
text: The world's richest man Elon Musk tweeted "work ethic expectations would be extreme" after he completes the $44 billion acquisition of Twitter. He added that expectations from Twitter employees will be "much less than I demand of myself". Musk earlier said Twitter will be "super focussed" on software engineering, design, information security and server hardware after he acquires Twitter.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bled through my pants, couldn't get a tampon during meeting: TikTok ex-employee
text: A former employee at TikTok claimed that she bled through her pants instead of leaving a meeting to get a tampon amid the high-pressure work culture at the company. In a recent report, former employees have cited 85 hours of meetings a week, lack of sleep and mental anguish as some of the things they faced at the company.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter CEO's wife is General Partner at VC firm backing Musk's Twitter deal
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal's wife Vineeta Agarwala is a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz, the venture capital (VC) firm that has agreed to invest $400 million in Elon Musk's Twitter takeover deal. Vineeta leads investments for Andreessen Horowitz's biotech and medical fund. As per reports, Musk is expected to serve as the temporary Twitter CEO after he completes the takeover.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: If cheap fuel is available, why won't we buy it?: FM on India buying Russian oil
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that it made "perfect sense" for India to buy Russian oil if it's being offered at a discounted rate, especially amid inflation. She added, "I think we'll go ahead with what is good for the country. We need cheaper fuel. If it is available, why won't we want to buy it? We will buy it."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: PNB hikes interest rates on select term deposits by up to 60 bps
text: Punjab National Bank (PNB) will increase interest rates on term deposits in selected buckets by up to 60 basis points with effect from today. It has also increased the repo-linked lending rate (RLLR) from 6.5% to 6.9% with effect from June 1 for existing customers. The move comes after several banks raised interest rates following the RBI's repo rate hike.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tata Group Chairman buys house he was living on rent for 5 yrs for ₹98 crore
text: Tata Group Chairman N Chandrasekaran and his family have purchased a duplex worth ₹98 crore in Mumbai's Pedder Road. The family had been residing in the duplex on lease for the last five years. Situated on the 11th and 12th floor of a 28-storey building, the family has reportedly been paying a monthly rent of ₹20 lakh for that house.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: ED staff threatened top executives with physical violence during probe: Xiaomi
text: Xiaomi alleged that its top executives faced threats of "physical violence" during questioning by Enforcement Directorate. It said that its India MD Manu Kumar Jain, current Financial Officer Sameer and their families were warned by ED officials of "dire consequences" if they didn’t submit the statements needed by them. ED had seized Xiaomi's ₹5,551 crore assets over forex violations recently.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Jet Airways CEO lists 'things to avoid' for airlines after experience with foreign airline
text: Newly-appointed Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor shared a list of what airlines should avoid. It was based on his recent travel experience in Europe. "Things to avoid- 1) Staff travellers...checking in at business class counter, holding up the line. 2) Having to remind...non-smiling, no greeting agent to put priority tag. 3) Poor priority boarding process for stairs gate," he wrote.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: HDFC hikes home loan rates by 30 bps after RBI's repo rate hike
text: HDFC on Saturday raised its Retail Prime Lending Rate (RPLR) on home loans by 30 basis points, which will be effective from May 9. Earlier, the lender had increased its benchmark lending rate by 5 basis points. Notably, the Reserve Bank of India hiked the repo rate by 40 basis points earlier this week.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: RBI rate hike wasn't surprising, its timing was: FM Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the recent interest rate hike by the RBI was not surprising for her but its timing was. "It came as a surprise because it came between two monetary policy reviews," she added. For the first time since August 2018, RBI on May 4 raised its key lending rate by 40 basis points to 4.40%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Top Infibeam executive R Srikanth, wife murdered by driver in Chennai after US return
text: R Srikanth, the head of corporate finance at finance company Infibeam, and his wife Anuradha were murdered by their driver Krishna in Mylapore in Chennai on Saturday. Srikanth and Anuradha had just returned to India after visiting their daughter in US. Krishna was arrested from Andhra Pradesh while attempting to escape to Nepal with some looted items in a car.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Anand Mahindra gifts a house to TN's 'Idli Amma' on Mother's Day; shares video
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra gifted a house to Tamil Nadu's M Kamalathal on the occasion of Mother's Day. Kamalathal, who is fondly known as 'Idli Amma', has been cooking and selling idlis for ₹1 for the past 30 years. "She's the embodiment of a Mother's virtues...A privilege to be able to support her and her work," Mahindra tweeted, sharing her video.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Anil Agarwal sings bhajan with his mother on video call on Mother's Day
text: The daughter of billionaire Anil Agarwal took to Twitter to share a video of the Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources singing a bhajan with his mother on the occasion of Mother's Day. "From feeding my belly with the most delicious ghee shakkar rotis, to helping me succeed in my goals...I owe it all to you, Maaji," Agarwal tweeted in reply.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt may privatise one of its 3 general insurers after LIC IPO launch: Report
text: After the launch of LIC's IPO, the Centre may privatise one of its general insurance companies this year, said a report. It detailed that by the time LIC is listed on stock exchanges, the government will start work to identify one of its three general insurers, namely, National Insurance Co., United India Insurance Co. and Oriental India Insurance for privatisation.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Jet Airways granted security clearance by Home Ministry
text: The Ministry of Home Affairs has granted security clearance to Jet Airways which is planning to relaunch commercial flight operations in the next few months, PTI reported citing an official document. The Jalan-Kalrock Consortium-led airline operated a test flight in Hyderabad last Thursday. It will now conduct proving flights, following which the DGCA will grant it the air operator certificate.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Loans worth ₹5,000cr approved for women, SC/ST entrepreneurs in FY22
text: More than 23,000 loans, worth around ₹5,000 crore, were sanctioned during FY22 to women and SC/ST entrepreneurs under the government's Stand-Up India scheme, government data showed. As of March 31, 2022, a total of 1.35 lakh applications amounting to around ₹30,200 crore were sanctioned. The scheme was launched in April 2016.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Centre releases revenue deficit grant of ₹7,183 cr to 14 states
text: The Centre on Friday released ₹7,183 crore as Post Devolution Revenue Deficit (PDRD) grant to 14 states, including West Bengal, Andhra Pradesh, Rajasthan and Punjab. This was the second monthly instalment of the PDRD grant. With this, the amount released in FY23 stands at ₹14,367 crore. The Fifteenth Finance Commission has recommended a total grant of ₹86,201 crore for FY23.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Tata Projects shortlisted for Noida airport construction
text: Tata Projects has been shortlisted to construct the terminal, runway and various other airside and landside facilities at the Noida International Airport in Jewar. As per reports, Tata Projects scored higher than other bidders, Larsen & Toubro and Shapoorji Pallonji Group, under the quality and cost-based selection criteria. It might reportedly get the contract after two-three weeks.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: Future Enterprises to raise ₹3,000 cr from insurance arm sale: Report
text: Debt-ridden Future Enterprises is planning to raise ₹3,000 crore by selling its insurance business to pare debts and avoid going into insolvency, reports said. FEL will reportedly sell its remaining 25% stake in Future Generali India Insurance (FGIICL) for ₹1,250 crore. It may also sell its 33.3% stake in Life Insurance JV-Future Generali India Life Insurance (FGILICL) for ₹400 crore.
author: Ananya Goyal

headlines: FPI ownership in equities falls to 19.5%, lowest since March 2019
text: Foreign portfolio investors' (FPIs) ownership in domestic equities of NSE500 companies fell to 19.5% in March 2022, according to Bank of America Securities India. This is its lowest level of FPI ownership since March 2019, when it was at 19.3%. FPI ownership was at its peak at 21.4% in December 2021. FPI ownership in March 2022 stood at $619 billion.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: We don't need to  acquire new assets to grow: Tata Steel MD
text: Tata Steel MD and CEO TV Narendran said the firm will look to grow organically and doesn't "really need to acquire new assets to grow [output]". "We will rely more on organic growth during this decade," Narendran said. "Right now, costs are stable, so steel prices are stable. We are comfortable with that," he added.
author: Ashley Paul
